greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let the number of digits in n be k; a(n) = sum of the products of the digits of n taken r at a time where r ranges from 1 to k.
comment: Differs from A264600 first at n=101: a(101) = 3 != A264600(101) = 12. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 20 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Symmetric polynomial.
program: (PARI) sympol(X, n)=my(s=0); forvec(i=vector(n, j, [1, #X]), s+=prod(k=1, n, X[i[k]]), 2); s ;
a(n) = my(d=digits(n)); sum(k=1, #d, sympol(d, k)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 06 2021
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 06 2001
ext: a(0)=0 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 20 2015
